Reviews.Title: From trepidation to elation....
Reviews.Author: DelBoy
Reviews.Content: With trepidation I ordered and recently received this particular security camera setup. Let me explain the trepidation, I wanted a wireless system to operate externally on my house but after reading many negative reports about the loss of signal due to building materials it has to travel through, I was lets say hesitant to click the 'confirm order button'. Now, I was fully aware that I need to install regular electrical outlets close to the camera locations, I did read somewhere that the plugs convert the power from AC to DC current so hard wiring the electrical cord was not an option you need a standard electrical outlet, easy enough but hard wiring the cameras back to the DVR was also not an option that's why I opted for the wireless cameras. Upon receiving the order I immediately got an electrical extension cord plugged in the camera and checked to see if I got a clear signal to the DVR at the furthest point away (about 65 feet) through stucco, wood framing with insulation, tile roof and wood flooring and even though the signal strength was 1 out of 4 bars, the picture was good and clear. Trepidation now replaced with elation, I installed all four cameras. Set up of the DVR was simple enough.The cameras do transmit on 2.4 GHz and did interfere with my WiFi BUT I have a Dual Band Router (I bought this about 2 years ago for about $100) and set everything else to 5.0 GHz, easy fix and all works well.Easy to get the app for my phone and Ipad, just inputted the required info and all works well.The system works as advertised for that I give it 5 stars, now let's see how well it stands up to the test of time.UPDATE....5-28-14.  Well, it's been 7 months since I did the install. One camera failed about 3 weeks ago (the one furthest away from the DVR) not sure of the reason but the power supply converter that you plug in to the wall outlet might have failed. I have sent the camera back to Lorex and have been told they will replace it free under warranty, we'll see...The only other thing is the software for my phone, at first it was OK but then became sporadic, so I tried 'Port Forwarding', difficult to achieve and didn't really solve the problem. Still working on that one.Outside of those 2 issues the system runs well, the other cameras still produce good quality pictures and survived a cold Colorado winter outside.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price...
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: The cameras work well. Very easy to set up. Software is very functional. Their support is VERY limited. If you have questions about things that are not in the manual (the manual I received didn't match the software) make sure you have PLENTY of time to sit on hold  before talking to a tech. The techs know 'the manual' but seem to have very little actual experience with the software. The only negative I have found is that you can't schedule email motion alerts. Once enabled, you receive alert emails even during work hours when you KNOW there's motion. You can schedule recording times. But not alert messages. I suggested to support they add this as an update suggestion. I was told they don't do software upgrades.But the product itself works as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Wireless cameras not quite wireless
Reviews.Author: ok2010
Reviews.Content: Purchased these for indoor as we've just hired a nanny and we wanted a simple setup to keep an eye on our little one. The camera setup was pretty straightforward - the only hiccup was setting up a mobile user for use with the iPhone and iPad app. Apparently you can only have one mobile user and you configure this user separately to the other user accounts. Go figure. Lorex tech support were helpful (if a little abrupt) and I managed to get remote viewing access pretty quickly.I probably would have happily given this product more stars if not for two things - the cameras aren't really "wireless" as you still have the power cable running from the cameras. The bit that's wireless is the video communication back to the DVR. While that is still helpful and much cleaner, the issue is that Lorex don't sell extension cables for the power supply, so you're camera placement is limited to within 6ft of your power outlets which is not ideal for all rooms in my apartment. I've seen an extension cable that might work, but nobody has used it for the wireless cameras so I'm trying to get Lorex to confirm before I buy them.The second issue is the user interface on the DVR itself. It has a bunch of useful features (you can set it to record only if it detects motion, set up motion alarms, and you can even configure the space that it detects the motion in)  but all of these features are hidden behind the most unintuitive menu options. Even playback of video is camera by camera and a little painful. This is one of those devices where you HAVE to read the detailed user manual page by page, or call tech support to find out how to do the one thing you're trying to do.The cameras themselves are good (if larger than I expected), the video quality is also good (although it needs a fair amount or light before it will switch to colour), and I would bump the review up to 4 stars if I can get the power cable extension sorted.

Reviews.Title: easy to set up
Reviews.Author: cryscon5
Reviews.Content: however the camera's tend to loose signal, and go bonkers. still trying to fix one of them, another camera just keeps coming and going.

Reviews.Title: Easy set-up but wi-fi hog
Reviews.Author: GlenO
Reviews.Content: Pros:Set-up was easy. Just plug the cameras into an outlet, set-up the DVR and it's ready to go.Cons:Massive wi-fi interference. Even with a router capable of 5GHz and fixing the 2.4GHz on one channel, it made my wi-fi network unacceptably slow with 4 cameras running. I went from 30mbs download to under 2 and sometimes 1 or nothing.I had to return. I liked the system other than the severe wi-fi issue.

Reviews.Title: Good system if you don't have an ATT wireless internet router
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A. Patterson "The Haunted Studios(tm)"
Reviews.Content: Just could not get this to peacefully co-exist with my ATT provided internet router.  Can't change routers to a more advanced spread frequency model as I must use this one for my VOIP access.  Too bad, this is a good little starter system, but it really should not be made to operate on the most commonly used wireless frequency.  As always I am grateful for amazon's return policy.

Reviews.Title: Can be made to work if you know what you are doing
Reviews.Author: Steven T. Mcdole "Steven"
Reviews.Content: It works, but it isn't perfect.  This is the cheapest wireless camera my family could find, and they didn't want to mess around running wires.  So it works.  However, here are some notes.Neutral:* You don't need this on your WiFi network to work.  It comes with a wireless transmitter/receiver per pair of cameras that hooks into the channel ports in place of the cable a regular camera would have used.* Decent quality.* About a week's worth of memory.* We have the highest quality DSL line in our rural area, and it caps out at 800 Kbps upload speed. Off the top of my head the manual stated a recommended upload speed of 1000 or 1100 Kbps if you want the mobile features.  Considering the network issues stated below we didn't even test this.Bad:* If you have a lower end, older single band wireless router kiss any Internet connectivity goodbye.  Thankfully the wireless range on these transmitters are iffy through solid walls so your neighbors will probably be fine, but we had to spend another $200+ upgrading out other computers and the Internet wireless network to work after installing this thing.* The menu system isn't the most inuitive unless you want to mess around with it for a bit.  It doesn't take long to figure out, but there are places where you would think you can move to the next section you have to hit menu (on most things cancel) to confirm your selection.* Occasionally the unit glitches out and you will have to power cycle (turn off and back on) to get the controls to work again.  The system still records while the controls are locked out.Personally, I'd give this system two stars.  It's a cheap for what it is.  My family who I set this up for would probably give it four stars complaining about range problems in their all brick home.  Older home so some of their internal walls even are brick inside of wood.  If you must have wireless cameras, but are crunched for money this system can work for you.  However, if you can afford better, but are trying to be frugal I would recommend going for better.

Reviews.Title: Interferes with WiFi
Reviews.Author: RoMeR
Reviews.Content: Great system except for one big problem- The camera to unit wireless signal interferes with WiFi signals- which everyone has.

Reviews.Title: Good produce
Reviews.Author: Connie V. Keller
Reviews.Content: I got the wireless thinking installation would be much easier for my boyfriend.  They work fine; however, when all 4 cameras are on it messes with our wireless connection for our computers and we can't get online.  So we disabled all but one (the one that observes driveway/mailbox) and now we can use our laptops again.  My house is rather small, so 1 or 2 cameras really is enough.  If I had a bigger house, maybe the wifi not working wouldn't be an issue either.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: subasniper
Reviews.Content: Great system but it interfered with my 2.4ghz wifi. I returned it but has great other than the wifi problem.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Piece of Mind
Reviews.Author: Mr. Quincy "Mr. Quincy"
Reviews.Content: Despite being a five star review, allow me to share a warning: setting this up takes a long time.  However, it is very much worth it.  The system give you great control over what it should record and when.  We used the remote viewing APP while sitting on the beach in Mexico to watch our house.  Incredible.  The image resolution is high quality.  The system can be configured with differing levels of motion sensitivity by camera to minimize false alarms. The system is far cheaper than hiring a security firm.  In a few months, you will have made your money back.One little complaint is that the mounting screws provided for the cameras are lousy. Made in China from cheap metal, which practically melt when tightened, making their removal really difficult.  It is worth taking a trip to the hardware store to buy some high quality ones for $2. It is a shame Lorex got cheap on something so inconsequential.Despite a few small details, we are overwhelmingly pleased with this system.  We were even giddy the first time we saw the video of the house while on vacation.  So comforting.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done
Reviews.Author: I. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I wish it came with a keyboard, the mouse is very on the cheap side. I wish the range was longer. For what I paid, i expected a lot more.

Reviews.Title: New Low in Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Jeff Warren
Reviews.Content: The Good: Set up to make the camera images appear on my monitor was fairly easy.  Image Quality was good.  The Bad: The literature and directions frequently leave you scratching your head.  Recording seems to start and stop at its own whim.  System requires re-booting frequently to restore the mouse functionality.  System WILL NOT transfer the images to ANY remote device.  The REALLY BAD:  Trying to get Lorex Customer service to help you resolve anything is akin viciously beating yourself in the head with an ice pick.  If there is anything you need Lorex customer service help with (and you will, the directions are not that clear to anyone with less than expert level experience), be prepared for very long waits on hold, a "ticket" system that is absurd (they "close" the ticket without resolving your problem and then make you go back to the beginning of the process), and overall just plain misery.

Reviews.Title: Customer services are horrible! And you will need them.
Reviews.Author: Singer
Reviews.Content: I'm real good with electronics(used to sell them), set up was pretty simple. I broke an antenna, though I'd get the extended range antenna, after an hour hold, they said it was compatible, it's not. They sent me another just like it, still not compatible, duh. Talked to Warranty department, tech dept, customer service.  (45 minutes hold each time)They don't know their own products! They said I need a whole different WRONG part. Called their sales department, held for 1 hour, they never answered, put in my number to call me back, nope 2 days later no calls. E-mailed them, they said they emailed back, nope, not in spam either. I'm running out of options quick. Camera system is working ok, NOTE: This is a 8 channel system but you can only have 4 wireless and 4 wired due to bandwidth. I'm running 5(6th antenna is broke) It's a jerky picture due to the overload in data. Just acceptable though. By the way never got the phone app to show a picture, it's digitized for some reason, but doubt they can help me. :(

Reviews.Title: Easy to install BUT.........
Reviews.Author: Gary Scott
Reviews.Content: This product was very easy to install even with the somewhat strange mouse only interface. The cameras work well in daylight and at night. However, the one camera that monitors an area illuminated by a sodium street light never switches into night vision and subsequently is a bit darker than the others. The greatest negative surprise was the impact the wireless camera communications had on my home wireless internet environment. The cameras, even when event driven, just killed the home wireless response. I saw my normal 95 to 100 Mbps response times drop to 5 to 10 Mbps due to the conflicts with the camera traffic, in the same frequency range, and ended up locating the Lorex DVR and the internet router at opposite ends of the house and three floors apart. This is not conducive to using the Lorex to provide internet access as it would need wired internet access through the router.  I even attempted to limit the impact by selecting and locking each individual channel within the wireless frequency range on my internet router to no avail. Overall, the unit was easy to install but fell short given the wireless conflicts that were created.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy It
Reviews.Author: Robert G. Schott "Stabob's Pet Houses"
Reviews.Content: Terrible system, constanly loses the picture, or the picture freezes and you think everything looks good but you a seeing a picture that froze 2 hours ago. Night vision is worthless unless the area is well lit.

Reviews.Title: LOREX  LHO18501C4WF SYSTEM
Reviews.Author: Helene G. Daigle
Reviews.Content: Easy easy easy easy easy easy easy easy easy to install and to use. If you need help, the Lorex techs. are very helpful on line or telephone.

Reviews.Title: Nice unit
Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: This is a nice low end camera system.  The resolution is a bit low but the system was not very expensive.  Very few connection issues and a couple of the cameras are 100 feet plus from the receiver.  Easy but basic operating system.  Plug and play setup.

Reviews.Title: Not for ME
Reviews.Author: Gary Nohs
Reviews.Content: If you have wireless anything ( computer, phone, printer, table ) they will stop working. There is no fix, called company, they said the only thing you can try is to lower resolution, and lower FPS... I sent mine back ,,if you don't plan to use your wireless network except for these camera's then I would say there very good ...

Reviews.Title: Easy DIY installation
Reviews.Author: Hiddentreasurebargains
Reviews.Content: My first wireless system.  I have an iphone and internet in my home with wireless (wireless not required, only a modem). Set was a snap, everything was included, cables, 4 cameras, power cords, etc.....just plugged it in, plugged in the included cable for my modem, plugged in the camera and receiver, filled out a couple on screen prompts (plugged included HDMI cable in to my spare monitor), with included DVR mouse, a few clicks, I was up and running....my iphone worked in 2 minutes with the app.  Simple, easy...I temporarily have my cameras mounted outside and powered with extension cables, I will get more appropriate power to them later.....Day time viewing  is GREAT (5), night time is a average (3) , I have the 4 included cameras hooked up, Monday I am calling Lorex to see if there is a better camera I can add for my other 4 channels.....I would like a little better viewing for night for vehicle security, but for $519 I am stoked, I also think if I had an HD monitor I would have better viewing...I will call Lorex Monday and find out.  But I am happy, especially compared to $3000 from the local company.

Reviews.Title: It's nice when it works.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Wimler
Reviews.Content: Cameras are used to watch my Mother-In-Law who has dimentia and lives alone. It doesn't seem these cameras, pan, tilt or zoom, it serves the basic need.  I didn't read all the reviews first, but the wireless means no wires to the DVR, it still has a wire for plugging into power.

Reviews.Title: decent system for the money.
Reviews.Author: jeff balsam
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is good, but not good enough to read license plates. Also the wireless cameras interfere with my wireless router. Unfortunately my computers run when the system is running. Tried changing router channels but because the radio frequency on the cameras constantly change you also have to keep changing the router channels. The built in Internet broadcaster also locks up periodically and does not allow you to access the system remotely. Other than those few quirks it is a great security system for the money.

Reviews.Title: Worst most un-user un-friendly system I have ever seen
Reviews.Author: Cathy A Koelsch
Reviews.Content: Installed system within distances as described in the directions. Two cameras did not have a signal. Software was installed on my desktop. Computer can not find the 'black box". The instructions give no information on how to operate system either with the mouse or software. Tech support is a minimum of a two hour wait time only to speak with some one that does not understand the problem. Updates are impossible because the "black box" can not find the "USB" even though there have been numerous USB's. Save your money and don't by this crap. I will not recommend anyone to buy this system or any Lorax system.

Reviews.Title: work good but
Reviews.Author: Mark B.
Reviews.Content: they work good, the only problem the office i worked at, that we installed them is they will confuse the wifi in the router and cause the wifi router to lock up. from the interference of the radio frequency the cameras use.

Reviews.Title: Was just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Reggie
Reviews.Content: This system met my needs and I can add to it with either wireless or wired cameras if I need to expand my views.  Set up was easy and it was working just like I needed it to right away.I like the capability of both wired and wireless cameras.The picture is clearWith the wireless cameras, I didn't have to run a lot of wire

Reviews.Title: Bought for a Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Mary Brosowske
Reviews.Content: Works great , but keep in mind it's not 100% wireless , you must plug in each camera,  it's easy to use and install.

Reviews.Title: neat product
Reviews.Author: Elwood Haas
Reviews.Content: having some minor installation issuesSo far instruction have worked wellConflict with IR sensors need to be resolvedWill see regarding recommendatios

Reviews.Title: I didn't like it at first, but it I am warming up to it.
Reviews.Author: Gerald Durden
Reviews.Content: I didn't like it at first, but it I am warming up to it.I decided to rate this a 3 although a 3.25 is closer to how I currently feel about this product.  Like my title says, I really didn't like this system after opening the box, but now I like it better.  I haven't figured out all features yet, but I am learning something new every day about the system.  So far, I have 1 camera setup with remote viewing.  I am in the process of installing the last 3 cameras.Installation:The actual installation is pretty easy.  It took close to 15 minutes to have atleast 1 camera up and running.  It comes with 4 cameras, 4 wireless receivers, 1 DVR, Ethernet cable, HDMI cable, a remote and a mouse.  For the most part, everything is plug and play. I would highly suggest plugging in a mouse to maneuver through the interface if you decide to connect to a computer monitor or TV.Video Quality.So far, the quality isn't bad.  It seems fairly average and gets the job down. I would need to do more testing to really test the quality.  I don't believe the camera has audio although.  I haven't performed a test to see if audio is included.  My first cam is on the opposite side of the house and I have received 2 bars which isn't bad at all.  For me, reception isn't a problem as the wireless receiver is extremely powerful.Remote ViewingI bought this system with the idea of remote viewing my home when away either from business or vacation.  IMO, the remote viewer when working is exactly what I expected. I can view live video or prerecorded video.  It took me a while setting up remote viewing as the directions were not clear.  Remote viewing requires a Lorex DDNS account on their website which took me a while to create.  See below for other issues.Cons:This system isn't perfect and includes some cons.  The biggest issue I had is with wifi interference/jamming and remote desktop setup.  This system uses similar technology to baby monitors (FHSS) which are known to cause interference.  It is almost impossible to not have some sort of interference with wifi.  Depending on where you place your receiver it can cause up to 90% drop in internet speed.  I have had speeds as low as .5 mbps and speeds as high as 12 mbps (max paid for).  There are a few workaround though.  I have noticed that the wireless receivers (not camera) are extremely powerful and can overpower your wifi router.  One solution is to move your wireless receiver atleast 3 feet away from your wireless router and wireless device.  Another solution is to weaken your receiver by placing aluminum foil on the antenna.  Last, you can use a dual band 5ghz router for your internet. I have also found changing your wifi router channel to either 1 or 11 will lessen interference due frequency hopping. The remote viewing works well once you get it to work. To me it was difficult to setup.  First of all, remote viewing requires you to connect your DVR to your router via a ethernet cable.  First, you will need to forward your ports (default 80).  Second you will need to create a Lorex DDNS account that is free.  Last you will have to register your device and start the warranty.  It took me a few tries to finally get it working.In conclusion, this is a pretty decent system for the price.  I recommend as a product to use if you want a basic wireless system with remote viewing and email alerts and do not mind occasional drops in internet speed with a workaround.I decided to rate this a 4 although a 3.5 is closer to how I currently feel about this product.  Like my title says, I really didn't like this system after opening the box, but now I like it.  I haven't figured out all features yet, but I am learning something new every day.  So far I have 1 camera setup with remote viewing.  I haven't tried all features yet.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy lady
Reviews.Author: MISS KITTY
Reviews.Content: As of today it has not been of much use.  I set it and a couple of days later it loses everything.  The instruction book is of no assistance at all.  I'm not even sure I got the actual instruction manual.  If it is, it is very lacking in the information I need. I had a deputy sheriff come to my house to ask for video of an incident that happened across the street from me and even she couldn't figure it out.  She saw the signs in my window and had hoped I was able to capture something that might solve the issue before having to make an arrest.  She had to make an arrest.  Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: Dont buy
Reviews.Author: Dean Lefebvre
Reviews.Content: This product worked for about a month.  1 Camera quit working and then the DVR would not boot up.  Called tech support and after a 2 hour wait I was connected to a customer service rep.  We could not ge the DVR to boot up.  He said that he would email me directions on how to get a replacement DVR.  Never got the email.  I emailed tech support at Lorex and was given the instruction to include my reciept of purchase.  Sent all the stuff in and never heard from them again.  I have since returned the item.  Crappy product and customer service.  Never again will I buy a Lorex product.

Reviews.Title: Figured out how to eliminate wireless disruption
Reviews.Author: Marc Stephens
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my dad's business, and set it up for myself to test first.  He wanted wireless cameras for easier installation.Setup is rather simple.  I was a bit surprised that the Lorex comes with its own two wireless bridges/routers, connecting two cameras each.  This means you don't control the connection.  I also don't like that you can't turn off the infrared night vision, which can hinder usage through windows.  (Though these are intended as outdoor cameras.)  Resolution is good.  Global access is very convenient.HINT: LorexDDNS.net, which allows you to connect to your camera DVR over the Web from anywhere in the world, probably won't work inside your own LAN network and/or behind your home router.  Use a VPN service, another location, or an LTE connection to test it.As for wireless hurdles, the reviews are correct -- initially, it absolutely strangled my household wireless network.  Since it uses its own routers, this is interference, not bandwidth usage.  You also can't manage or QoS-limit the traffic like you would a game or HD media stream or other wireless application.  However, I solved this considerable problem by adjusting my wireless architecture as follows:My equipment is a Netgear WNDR4000 Dual Band Wireless Router.  Before, I was using it as a wireless bridge/repeater to my base wired router (same model).  Instead I attached it directly to the network via wired switch and set it up as an access point.  I think the key here is the 4000's dual-band capability.  I set up both bands as NG-Mixed.  Since Lorex said their wireless uses 802.11G channel 14, I set the first band on Channel 1 20 MHz channel width, and band two on Auto with Auto channel width.  Both are set up as Bridged.  Apparently this lets all our devices connect fine with Wireless N.  I have plenty of wireless experience, but would not consider myself a networking genius.  However, I do know that setting up N-Only on 5GhZ (my first instinctive solution) did not work, because nothing would connect.  After lots of trial and error, this is the setup that allows your wireless network to function alongside the Lorex.

Reviews.Title: Not Wireless Friendly
Reviews.Author: slabar
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the cameras billed themselves as being wireless friendly but I found out that is not the case.  I went from having a 30+mbps connection down to less than 3mbps connection as soon as the cameras were connected into my wireless network.  Needless to say after some testing and failure to resolve the degradation of my wireless connection these cameras were returned.

Reviews.Title: great product for the price.
Reviews.Author: Mick
Reviews.Content: A bit of a pain to setup but learning curve is quick. Not having issues others mentioned.Router problems: my router and Lorex unit are all together in the den and having zero issues with wifi interfence. My son has a frequency signal scanner from work and showed me that neither is on the same frequency to interfere with each other. 3 people can be viewing netflix while 4th checks the cameras on the laptop through 1 router.Only able to configure one hand-held device: have configured my droid, wife's I-phone/pad and the laptop to show live (few second delayed) cameras.All in all took a day to perfect the setup but easy to adjust and monitor.

Reviews.Title: easy to install no wifi interruption
Reviews.Author: dawn dennis
Reviews.Content: lotsa reviews said it interrupted the wifi but it doesn't and it is very easy to put up and hook up ,, make sure you have a monitor to hook it too

Reviews.Title: wi fi
Reviews.Author: Farmape
Reviews.Content: It took a day to hook up because the directions suck, no customer service, the mounting screws are small, you cant rotate the camera all the way, but worst of all the App doesnt work -something to do with the wii. It does work over regular internet.

Reviews.Title: Like product
Reviews.Author: Cynthia R Scherry
Reviews.Content: Did take some time to set up cameras by myself.  Running back and forth between cameras and PC monitor to set up viewing areas.  Also time consuming learning the menu options.  I always do things without reading/viewing instructions.  Trial and error with menu.  Picture quality good. System in place few weeks now.

Reviews.Title: Ok product
Reviews.Author: sergio
Reviews.Content: Cameras view are no to clear and also every single time  I'm out home I have problem connecting with the cameras

Reviews.Title: malfunctioning devices - returning this order
Reviews.Author: H. A. "habadzi"
Reviews.Content: In principle this ought to be a very good product. Maybe I got a bad package, but it's going back and getting replaced by something else.These wireless cameras can be set inside a house or outside.  They are good at seeing in the dark, but they also need to be pretty close to their transmitter. Just 1-2 drywall walls, and they don't operate.I installed it and went overseas.  I saw 2 of the 4 cameras for one day, then they disappeared forever.  When I got back, I found that their wireless transmitter had conked out.  The other two performed as expected.  But also the hard drive did not record anything.  On return, I banged it and it started, but despite 2 hours with technical support, I could not get it to record.  The support folks said to just return the order.At any rate, the system was erratic.  Sometimes it said 'failed', and I did not know if power or the internet were out.  But normally the house does not have so many disruptions.By comparison, I have two lorex ip cameras in an apartment, and they perform admirably.  The 32 gig microSD records, they send messages if someone opens the door.  And that apartment is in a country where the wifi and power would have been expected to perform worse.

Reviews.Title: Not for us!!
Reviews.Author: NPG
Reviews.Content: First let me agree with the many others who have warned about the LOUSY support Lorex offers for their products. Yes if you have over an hour to wait on the phone to then be rushed through your questions and then before you know it you are off the phone and WAIT!! IT STILL DOES'NT WORK WELL! Then this may be the product for you. Our system played back a full five seconds slower than real time. The clock on the camera counted it off so we could easily see it. The tech support said there was no way to speed it up. I am sorry but I don't want to spend more than real time trying to watch what is going on.  We even put it on motion only and that was still impossibly slow to get through.  We are not stupid people, but it seemed the set up, the running of, and the entire system is just poor. If they would just pay someone to take the time to make a really detailed how to manual, much better than the one that comes with it on the disc maybe the support lines wouldn't be covered up.  Still that would not make the actual product better.  Yes the pictures are extremely clear that is where the two stars come from.  We were able to see well.  But there was a time that we knew my husband was in the line of sight of the camera and he did not even show up on the recording.  What else is the thing going to miss? A robbery?? Sorry Lorex, this product is NOT FOR US!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality and Technology for the Price
Reviews.Author: bignewf93 "JeffR"
Reviews.Content: Incredible technology, excellent value for the price. I read several reviews about the company and the product, so I decided to try it. Amazon had the best price, and being a customer for years and knowing their customer service is excellent,  I purchased it from them. Setup takes about 20 minutes with easy to install software. The camera resolution is excellent, and the  best part is the excellent resolution at night! The manufacturer's specs are truthful here. I live on a dark wooded lot, and after looking at the images at nightfall I was truely amazed. The DVR unit has many advanced recording features, many of which I probable will never use. The wireless signal is excellent, and requires no setup out the box other than plugging the receivers into the DVR unit.There are a few minor drawbacks, such as the power adapter (AC to DC) cords to the camera being only 6 feet.  But for outdoor installation you can use a standard outdoor rated extension cord and enclose it in inexpensive conduit. I called Lorex and they stated you can buy an extension for the power adapter in Radio Shack or any online electronic supplier.The only other minor drawback I found is that the web browser only works in Internet Explorer, not in Chrome or Firefox. It does work in Safari, though.  Being a linux user, I am not fond of Internet Explorer or Windows, but another option for remote viewing is that it does come with a software client for pc and mac which you can use in place of a web browser.You cannot beat this product for the quality and price, and ease of setup. Even with the few minor annoyances, I have to give this product five stars.

Reviews.Title: Great as long as you dont mind losing your wireless network
Reviews.Author: ERIC J CORDELL
Reviews.Content: Purchased this item for use in our home as a nanny cam. Great product with great quality and results. If you plan on accessing the DVR remotely using DDNS, it works flawlessly. My only complaint is that it interferes with my wireless home network. No matter where I put the wireless receivers, I cannot surf the web quickly. If I unplug the wireless receivers in the evening after the nanny is gone and my internet comes back up without issue.

Reviews.Title: It's an OK product.
Reviews.Author: David Barnes
Reviews.Content: I mulled over whether wireless or wired for some time and read many reviews.  I don't think the wireless was the right decision but I was smart enough to buy the unit with 8 ports with the 4 wireless cameras so I can buy wired cameras when I need to.Here are my experiences.First the negatives.  The wireless cameras allowed me to find the best location for each camera, but as I read in another review you still have to run a cable for power to the camera so it may be just as easy to run the cable to a wired device.  The length of cables supplied is disappointing at the very least, the cable from the DVR to the wireless receiiver is so short it's useless ( I haven't yet asked Lorex it they supply an extension) but if I coud install the wireless receivers the other side of my outside wall I could get maximum connectivity and a clear view of the cameras.  The HDMI cable has the same shortcoming, it's too short.  I bought a much longer HDMI cable which suits the needs.  The zoom on the DVR is dissapointing it switches from far away to a little bit closer but doesn't zoom as I understand the definition of Zoom, to go real close.Here are the postiivesI am impressed with the night vision.  I can clearly see the gate at the end of my property about 200 ft away and any activity at the gate, in total darkness we have no street lighting and no lights on the property. Daytime picture clarity is excellent.All in all the product exceeded my expectations and achieved what I wanted to be able to see any activity on the property 24 hours a day if necessary without going outside.I mulled over whether wireless or wired for some time and read many reviews. The HDMI cable has the same shortcoming, it's too short.  I bought a much longer HDMI cable which suits the needs. There was a video attached to the product specification which does not portray reality.  The movements are not real time at all there is some delay between moving and seeing it on the TV the video is misleading but not a show stopper, maybe it would be better with the wired version of camera.Here are the postiivesI am impressed with the night vision. Daytime picture clarity is excellent.All in all the product exceeded my expectations and achieved what I wanted to be able to see any activity on the property 24 hours a day if necessary without going outside.

Reviews.Title: Great for our needs
Reviews.Author: Linda J. Gordon
Reviews.Content: We're using this to monitor our home when we are away, because we have caregivers with our elderly parent.  The four cameras are all wireless, and our DVR has 8 channels, so we have the potential to plug in more cameras, but have not yet done so.  The cameras we are using are all located fairly close (separate rooms) to the DVR....but the signal does have to go through walls in the house.  We're having good results so far.

Reviews.Title: Works as expected.
Reviews.Author: Bob Kneisel
Reviews.Content: Cameras easily installed, set up and configured.  Only needed to call technical support for clarification to setup motion detection recording.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised
Reviews.Author: joseph
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised that this Lorex product did as advertised. My experience with Lorex in the past has not been so good, so this system really stood out. The pictures generated from the cameras are exceptionally clean, and I received pictures from two cameras that were mounted outside with a concrete wall between transmitter and receiver. Now we just have to wait and see what kind of longevity this system will provide.

Reviews.Title: Had to return...
Reviews.Author: Honest Abe
Reviews.Content: Had to return...Too good to be true I guess. The set up was easy enough, worked fine from the onset, only problem was that being that you have to set this item next to your router, apparently the wireless hubs that control the camera has a sends out wireless signals that totally weakens your wireless signal for anything else in the home or office.In my case I didn't realize this , until after about an hour phone call conversation with my wireless provided screaming at them that their service was lousy.It turned out, once I disconnected the camera system, my interest service was better than ever.I run a small business, I need my wifi more than I do a security camera.Camera system went back. Within 2 days Amazon posted my credit. Amazon customer service still the best!

Reviews.Title: Excellent System and EASY to set up
Reviews.Author: Jewel McDonald
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an exterior home surveillance system and this works great.  This system was super easy to install and we were up and running in a couple hours.  I also loved how you can download apps and view it from anywhere.  The apps also worked super easy.  We are going to order 2 more cameras for the inside of our home so we can also watch the dogs during the day while we are at work.

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: Alan Conley
Reviews.Content: Worked prefectly out the box.  Easy to setup. Just plugged in the cameras and DVR and it was up and running.  The on screen software is easy to use and very logical.  I had the remote operation through the internet working in about 10 min.  The picture quality is good. Its not HD but good enough to see what is going on.  One camera is about 300 ft away and has a good signal at the house.

Reviews.Title: Lorex Is A Wonderful Product
Reviews.Author: Allan Miller
Reviews.Content: I installed these cameras and they work to my full expectations!  I finally feel comfortable to leave town with a view of my house at all time from my iPhone! I am rating this a 4 star only because it slowed my speed to everything else portable.  The signal for wifi is the same that the wireless cameras use.  There is a fix, but still working on it.
